Vagabonding: An Uncommon Guide to the Art of Long-Term World Travel

I have since seen reference as early as 1871 (in Marc Twain, Roughing it) but I've never found it in any dictionary. In a way, it's a kind of nonsense word â€“ playfully adapted to describe a travel phenomenon that was already out there when Walt Whitman wrote, "I or you pocketless of a dime may purchase the pick of the earth".
